result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Guadalupe M. Garza Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Guadalupe M. Garza in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF69,  15CM148, 15CM186, 15CM198, 15FO128 & 15FO129 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2 in 15CF69 and Ct 1 in 15CM186.  Counts 1, 3 & 4 in 15CF69, 15CM148, 15CM198 to be dismissed and read-in.  15FO128 and 15FO129 to be dismissed.
Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CF69 and Ct 1 in 15CM186.  Counts 1, 3 & 4 in 15CF69, 15CM148, 15CM198 to be dismissed and read-in.  
15FO128 and 15FO129 to be dismissed.

The State agrees not to charge out 15-SO3025 per the agreement.
  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2 in 15CF69 and Ct 1 in 15CM186:  Withhold Sentence; 18 months Probation with conditions:
*20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; on Ct. 2 in 15CF69
  Report on or before  April 15, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
*$100.00 Domestic Abuse Surcharge on Ct. 2 in 15CF69
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*Comply and complete any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Counts 1, 3 & 4 in 15CF69, 15CM148, 15CM198 to be dismissed and read-in.  
Credit to be determined by stipulation from counsel; only available if revoked.

15FO128 and 15FO129 to be dismissed.

Defendant Guadalupe M. Garza in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Frank requests new return date and that all matters be held at the same time.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

CASES TRACKING TOGETHER:
15CM148 - D/C
15FO128 - POSSESSION OF DRUG PARAPHERNALIA - 1st
15FO129 - POSSESSION OF THC - 1st
PETITION FOR LEAVE TO FILE ADDITONAL MOTIONS

Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Guadalupe M. Garza. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Guadalupe M. Garza not in court.

Atty Frank states that he did not know that the felony case would be heard today.  Atty Hendee states that he just sent Atty Frank the complaint and both would need to be addressed.
Atty Hendee states that he jus emailed him today.

BY THE COURT:  Court will continue with the 15CF69 matter.

Atty Hendee states that Mr. Garza has been wanted for some time now and is concerned about no bond on that matter.
Atty Frank states that he will accept service on the CM matter.  Court questions Atty Frank.  Atty Frank would accept it on the CF case also.
Atty Hendee asks that Mr. Garza have to appear for booking.  Atty Frank agrees.

Court reads the criminal complaint in the CF case.  Atty Frank is prepared to proceed.
Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
No contact with Christine Garza or her residence for the pendency of the case.  Mr. Garza is allowed one time with Law Enforcement to return to the home to get his belongings.
Court permits that the 2008 Dodge will be able to be picked up by Mr. Garza if no other family order is in affect.
Mr. Garza is to report to the Marquette County Sheriff's office to sign the bond within 24 hours.

15CM148:
  Atty Frank received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Frank enters a Not Guilty plea.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.

15CF69: 
Court finds probable cause.
Atty Frank waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.
Set for Prelim.
15CM148 will track
